SENT.plain: We report a case of neonatal purpura fulminans associated with activated protein C resistance
Analysis of DNA demonstrated heterozygosity for the factor V R506Q mutation
The neonate, at 8 hours of age, had progressive purpuric skin lesions and later had evidence of microvascular, hemorrhagic thrombosis in the brain
The baby was treated with fresh frozen plasma infusions and had complete resolution of the skin lesions and no apparent long-term complications
We suggest that activated protein C resistance testing be included in the initial evaluation of neonatal purpura fulminans
